text:
Eight persons were injured after a van ferrying day labourers to a garment unit rammed a tamarind tree in Denkanikottai on Saturday.

The injured were being ferried to a garment unit along Karnataka border for daily labour at the time of accident.

According to the police, 20 passengers from the outlying villages were travelling in the van bound to Anekal in Karnataka when the brakes of the vehicle failed. The driver in a bid to stop the van rammed it against a tree.

The injured were taken to Denkanikottai government hospital. Ill-maintained vans are significant mode of transport in the outlying areas of Denkanikottai that is dogged by poor State-run transport modes.
title: Eight injured in accident
